title: Lessons Learned From Flint
description: The infrastructure bill moving through Congress includes billions to replace lead pipes. In Flint, Mich., NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with residents on how governments can tackle a water crisis equitably.

itunes:summary: With tens of billions of dollars in the infrastructure bill aimed towards clean water nationwide, we look to Flint, Mich. for lessons that city can offer the rest of the U.S.
